description: Students not only investigate the theory of modern analytical chemistry, but also examine the statistical treatment of errors, equilibrium, activities, acid/base chemistry, spectroscopy, electrochemistry, and separations. The accompanying lab course, CHEM 256, illustrates the topics discussed in CHEM 255. Students taking this course use computers for solving problems. Prerequisites: CHEM 126 or CH/BI 227 or permission of the instructor, and concurrent registration in CHEM 256. Offered each semester. Counts toward environmental studies major (all tracks) and concentration.
name: Analytical Chem
notes: Students in Chem 255 must also register for one Chem 256 lab.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: CHEM 126 or CH/BI 227 or permission of the instructor, and concurrent registration in CHEM 256. Offered each semester. Counts toward environmental studies major (all tracks) and concentration.
title: Analytical Chemistry
